title: Anastasia_D40
author: Anastasia_D40
content: Hello everyone, I have a new question, In your opinion, is it worth attending blockchain events?

comments.author: Zaguru12
comments.body: Quote from: Anastasia_D40 on June 15, 2023, 03:46:52 PMis it worth attending blockchain events?Seminars or events like that are create place to interact and gain knowledge about things, and also meet great developers. Concerning blockchain technology it is very verse and there are actually many things on it aside cryptocurrency. So to your question i would say attend events on blockchain if the aspect or the theme of the seminar is not frowned upon by your country government. If for an example bitcoin or cryptocurrency at large is banned in your country, attending an event on it exposes your privacy and you could be possibly be violating a law on that. So it depends on the kind of blockchain event you’re attending and also your country’s law guiding that.

comments.author: Hyphen(-)
comments.body: Quote from: Anastasia_D40 on June 15, 2023, 03:46:52 PMHello everyone, I have a new question, In your opinion, is it worth attending blockchain events?Yes.Blockchain technology is very good, as the world is now entirely migrating to it due to its transparency; therefore, attending such events is beneficial because you will learn a lot from different developers.Moreover, if you want to learn more about Bitcoin, blockchain technology will make it easier for you to understand the concept.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: Attending such function is not necessary but it is some worth important. Seminars creates avenue to get acquainted with more projects and like-minded people around the world. There you can meet investors and good project teams if you have any project too, you could have the opportunity to showcase yourself to the Crypto world to see who is looking for it.Concerning a country's ban on Crypto and the possibility of Crypto enthusiast holding a seminar there is very risky. There you could be exposing yourself to risk because sometimes the government can send in agents to go monitoring the events activities and possibly making a prosecution on those who organized the event and likewise the attendees too which is not safe.

comments.author: Eternad
comments.body: Quote from: Anastasia_D40 on June 15, 2023, 03:46:52 PMHello everyone, I have a new question, In your opinion, is it worth attending blockchain events?I’m no expert but it is worth it if you have the passion on learning it especially if the event is free entry for all participants. I attended one of blockchainevent  here in our country hosted by a popular exchange. I learned a lot but since I’m not a developer or involved on computer programming, I don't appreciate much the technical knowledge aside from key knowledge involved on blockchain.It will be helpful if you can provid the link to the event so that we can review the scope of topics and wha’t the background of the speaker involved. This is crucial to determine the worth of that event.

comments.author: Onset
comments.body: It’s worth it only if you care about the speakers or what they’re gonna talk about. Or, if you want to make connections and learn more about the subjects the speakers will present.It’s very important to make sure you choose an event of interest. There’s no point going to a blockchain event if they’re gonna talk about coins you don’t care about. It’s just as pointless to go there if you’re a Bitcoiner and only altcoin founders will talk, unless you’re interested in learning more about other projects.Overall, I think there’s some information you’ll learn regardless of the event that will open your mind more and teach you new things. But again, it’s not as easy as a yes/no answer.

comments.author: pawanjain
comments.body: Quote from: Anastasia_D40 on June 15, 2023, 03:46:52 PMHello everyone, I have a new question, In your opinion, is it worth attending blockchain events?It's a great place to meet like minded people and to get some great insights about the technology.Not only you get to learn a lot of things but you get to be a part of the community in real world.Unfortunately, I haven't got a chance yet to attend such events but when I get one I will make sure not to miss it.So you should grab the opportunity while you have it and do share your experience with us.

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: Quote from: Anastasia_D40 on June 15, 2023, 03:46:52 PMIn your opinion, is it worth attending blockchain events?No knowledge is a waste, blockchain technology experience is needed if you're into bitcoin in other for you to understand more better on how the whole process works, knowing that blockchain is the sole background technology that every bitcoin transactions and storage takes place, as a complete discussion, bitcoin is never fully understood without the blockchain technology and this will help you understand more better about bitcoin itself and widens your scope.

comments.author: panganib999
comments.body: Quote from: Anastasia_D40 on June 15, 2023, 03:46:52 PMHello everyone, I have a new question, In your opinion, is it worth attending blockchain events? For connections, exposure, and socializing? Yes for sure. Blockchain events also give way for a lot of promising projects out there to flourish and be showcased before it gets into the public. Plus if you're into attending hackathons (which good thing right now is already dedicating whole sections of the event for cryptocurrency-related projects) you'd see a lot of promising project prototypes that would give you great insight as to what the future of cryptocurrency is leaning towards. All in all it's a genuinely positive experience even if you're someone who's not really into attending such events as it still caters to the people by offering all forms of entertainment that is legally allowed, plus most of them offer trinkets and awesome loot just for attending! So yeah it's something that a cryptocurrency enthusiast should look into joining in the near future.

comments.author: ajiz138
comments.body: Why not if it makes it easier for you to understand blockchain, because with a seminar with this event at least you know and can socialize with other people who attend the event.Then where is the confusion if it's not feasible?Now I see a lot of this seminar and many are enthusiastic for those who participate it means they still need some further knowledge than searching the internet themselves.But to be honest, I've never done a seminar on blockchain events before.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: Anastasia_D40 on June 15, 2023, 03:46:52 PMHello everyone, I have a new question, In your opinion, is it worth attending blockchain events?In my opinion it is worthy to attend those blockchain events if you can reach to the destination where the event takes place without any travelling issues. I mean if an event is to be conducted in a place and the location of the place where the event is scheduled to take place isn't far away from your home town then attending that event best decision one could make to learn about blockchain in detail.Those events are conducted to promote awareness about blockchain and its use cases. If you attend those events you will get inspiration from the ones who are conducting those events and at the same time you will learn a lot from them related to Bitcoin and blockchain. The ones who conduct those events are mainly specialists of the blockchain system and they have deep knowledge about blockchain and the technology behind it. You'll learn a lot about blockchain by attending those events because we learn things far better when they are taught by the experts of the field. If the blockchain events are free then that's the best thing ever to attend but if it has little fee then still it's worthy to attend those events. I would most probably recommend you to avoid the events that has very fees because they are mainly conducted to loot the attendees and may not offer much valuable knowledgeable things because of greediness to create more such events in future to accumulate more money.

comments.author: BlackHatCoiner
comments.body: Quote from: Anastasia_D40 on June 15, 2023, 03:46:52 PMIn your opinion, is it worth attending blockchain events?I hope I don't sound as an AI, but: it depends. - Are you looking to build a career around that, and try to get linked in? Then yes, it's worth it.- Are you fine knowing that you'll attend in a place where the people become targets for $5 wrench attacks? Then go for it. - Is there anything you believe you can't find out elsewhere, except in such events? Go.But in my opinion, it isn't worth it. Let alone, most of these "blockchain events" are organized by people who want to promote their shitcoin agenda.

comments.author: famososMuertos
comments.body: Quote from: Anastasia_D40 on June 15, 2023, 03:46:52 PMHello everyone, I have a new question, In your opinion, is it worth attending blockchain events?Once I attended an event on electronic security, it was not my specific area, but I like everything related to technology, anyway, after that event I ended up developing a business and creating business relations.In any case, there is always a very well-established schedule topics and speakers for this type of event, so attend what really interests you and what you know about.

comments.author: Russlenat
comments.body: Quote from: Anastasia_D40 on June 15, 2023, 03:46:52 PMHello everyone, I have a new question, In your opinion, is it worth attending blockchain events?Yes, of course! If you have the time and resources to attend such events, why not? As crypto enthusiasts, we enjoy participating in these kinds of gatherings as they enhance our knowledge about cryptocurrency and provide an opportunity to meet successful individuals in the crypto space. Additionally, attending such events can help us learn how to effectively manage our crypto assets and ensure their security. It's definitely worth giving it a try!

comments.author: lionheart78
comments.body: If you wanted to know more about cryptocurrency then attending events is a good thing.  Since you cannot ask the internet directly, in even you are able to ask the panel if there is a question and anwer scheduled for that event.  Another good thing is that the topic at hand is explained deeply and listeners are able to grasp the information behind it and at the same time can ask questions about the effect and importance of the said topic in the economy or industry.

comments.author: Z-tight
comments.body: It may be worth it for some people, but it isn't worth it for me. I'm not the kind of person who looks forward to meeting people, even if we share the same beliefs. If the blockchain event is about the BTC blockchain, i believe we all can support and learn about the network without discussing physically. People who don't have a problem with it can go, but i think the disadvantages and risks outweigh the benefits.The best thing that can happen if you go is that you meet up with people, or if they have special guest speakers that you admire, you get to see them, but the worst thing that can happen is you will probably compromise your privacy and you can be a target of a $5 wrench attack, so you can now decide for yourself.

comments.author: mendace
comments.body: Quote from: Anastasia_D40 on June 15, 2023, 03:46:52 PMHello everyone, I have a new question, In your opinion, is it worth attending blockchain events?It depends on the type of event and your level of education, particularly if you haven't learned the basics yet and the event is very technical it won't help at all indeed maybe it could be counterproductive and it will confuse you.  Personally, I have started local meetings in various cities of Italy between Bitcoiners to meet and talk but above all they serve to clarify some by discussing between us.

comments.author: BVeyron
comments.body: Quote from: Anastasia_D40 on June 15, 2023, 03:46:52 PMHello everyone, I have a new question, In your opinion, is it worth attending blockchain events?It depends on your interests. There are different types of cryptocurrency-related events. Some of them would be interesting for you, while some wouldn't... Cryptoindustry is a vast field with many branches. Most branches have their own events (hardware, software, cryptography, trading etc).

comments.author: seoincorporation
comments.body: Quote from: Anastasia_D40 on June 15, 2023, 03:46:52 PMIn your opinion, is it worth attending blockchain events?Those event's are important if you want to get involved in new technologies involving the blockchain, there you can learn a lot of topics like NFT, Staking, Smart Contracts, Security, and all the relevant topics for the blockchain.And the most important is how those events are used to introduce new technologies involving blockchaing. So, I don't say we need to be in every blockchain even, but at least we can see the conference topics and if we find something interesting then it is worth being part of it.

comments.author: AmoreJaz
comments.body: Quote from: seoincorporation on June 15, 2023, 10:01:33 PMQuote from: Anastasia_D40 on June 15, 2023, 03:46:52 PMIn your opinion, is it worth attending blockchain events?Those event's are important if you want to get involved in new technologies involving the blockchain, there you can learn a lot of topics like NFT, Staking, Smart Contracts, Security, and all the relevant topics for the blockchain.And the most important is how those events are used to introduce new technologies involving blockchaing. So, I don't say we need to be in every blockchain even, but at least we can see the conference topics and if we find something interesting then it is worth being part of it.in my opinion, if you have a business and you want to connect with the right people, this is worth to attend to. but if you are just a regular crypto user, you can always learn things over the internet. but it is your prerogative if you want to mingle with people who have the same interest. also, if you can afford to attend such events, why not? this will be added experience for you and learn other things that you can't get over the net.
